page.title: 10TRADE IN LEADENHAM
page.content: Leadenham Village Stores and Post Office is run by Derek Stokes and his wife with the help of part time assistants.They stock a good range of groceries as well as well as bread, fruit,vegetables and frozen foods. Other useful items are stocked such as stationery,batteries,sweets and tights.An off licence has recently opened when the shop was enlarged. Bags of coal are also obtainable and orders can always be delivered.The Post Office is a great asset to the Village,dealing with pensions and allowances as well as all aspects of Post Office business.The other shop in the Village is a newsagents and tobacconists which also sells other useful goods.A travelling butchers van calls twice a week, the fishmonger once,the baker three times,the mobile bank once,the library fortnightly.
